P(positive test  | vampire) = 0.95
P(positive test  | mortal) = 0.01
P(vampire) = 0.001

Law of total probability
P(positive test) 
= P(positive test | vampire) * P(vampire) + P(positive test | mortal) * P(mortal)
= 0.95*0.001 + 0.01*(1-0.001) = 0.01094


Bayes theorem: P(A|B) = P(B|A) * P(A) / P(B)
 
P(vampire|positive test) 
= P(positive test|vampire)*P(positive test) / P(vampire)
=0.95*0.001/0.01094
